result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce Lee Dennis Jr.

records.addlTxt: Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

8:56 AM Defendant Bruce Lee Dennis Jr. not in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record and notes DEF non-appearance. State requests a bench warrant for the State of Wisconsin only. Court grants the bench warrant and orders the bail bond forfeiture proceedings to commence.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Dennis, Bruce L.  JR     CASE:  22100325

Possession of Meth
Possession of THC
Resisting or Obstructing
Probation Violation

11:56 AM  DE Bruce Dennis  in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt  (special appearance) appears by video. Bruce R Poquette appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Thomas Schmidt no objection.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 11/1/2022 at 8:30AM.  

SIBS  $2500   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
